DataElement.preferredName: Primary Cause of Death  Diagnosis Original Result Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The high level category that describes the primary reason for a patient death.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Death Diagnosis Domain Primary Cause of Death Death Diagnosis Original Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to death diagnosis._The first significant event which ultimately led to death._The outcome of the death diagnosis assessment as originally received or collected.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to death diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to death diagnosis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Elevated to Standard per governance approval by RA. 2021-6-9 ak. Released. AK 2020-6-10; Created as part of the CDISC mapping task_ghd_08.27.18

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The circumstance or condition that results in the death of a living being._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects associated with the action or administration of therapeutic agents.

Concepts.definition: The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects associated with the action or administration of therapeutic agents.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A primary malignant neoplasm in a patient who has been already diagnosed with a primary malignant neoplasm in another anatomic site.

Concepts.definition: A primary malignant neoplasm in a patient who has been already diagnosed with a primary malignant neoplasm in another anatomic site.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication or description of the correlation between a finding or event of interest and a treatment outside the specifications of a study.

Concepts.definition: An indication or description of the correlation between a finding or event of interest and a treatment outside the specifications of a study.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC Aligned NCI Standard Equivalent CDE
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is to be used for CDISC aligned data collection in place of CDE 4783273 from the original NCI Standard CRF Template.
